name: Raffles Dubai

reviews.text: This hotel has a very large lobby, not very far from airport, has a shopping mall attached to it but not quite the one the likes of mall of emirates or Dubai mall but you can visit once, it was my second stay and i am perfectly all right with the room, you can have a good night sleep, breakfast is great but not excellent. Bathroom is quite big.
reviews.title: Luxury/Large room hotel situated bit away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However i should admit it is overly valued because when you stay in a hotel by shaikh zayad road, you get the benefit of being closer to shopping malls and easy access to metro.
reviews.title: The Best of the Best
Perfect for us
reviews.text: We have stayed at many 5 star hotels all over the world: United Kingdom, Singapore, Indonesia, Malaysia, Australia, United States and Chile: this hotel in Dubai was the best. It began with our arrival, when the doorman 'Moses' greeted us with his cheerful welcome and beaming smile.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was amazing with an early arrival granted after a long and tiring flight. It was our anniversary and we were so well looked after, and we were congratulated by many of the staff. I think the key to this hotel's success is its staff. They all were genuinely friendly and cheerful. Nothing was too much trouble. Chefs came and spoke with us about our meals, managers consulted us for feedback. They didn't just talk about customer service, they delivered. My hotel of choice for future visits.
reviews.title: Wow!!

reviews.text: An absolute perfect hotel for the holiday we wanted. In a quiet location, next to a large shopping mall (wafi), only 500yds to the fantastic metro system. A great rooftop bar. Brilliant swimming pool with a 'swim-up' bar.
reviews.title: Couldn't be happier!
True Luxury
reviews.text: Best experience, from the check in at the Club Lounge, to the very spacious and well appointed room, great view, perfect service, to the culinary experience. To reach the hotel from the airport is easy, but from the other side, impossible to find the way, please improve the signage.
This is definitely a five star plus hotel which lives up to the Raffles name.
reviews.title: An Oasis in the Desert

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The décor throughout the hotel is fascinating. The rooms are huge and luxurious. The bathroom was perfect but the bonus was the sitting area on balcony.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: The most outstanding feature of this hotel is the service. From check in to check out, not only is the service tops but they make you feel like family especially our butler Lillian.
reviews.title: Best business hotel I have ever been to

reviews.text: The hotel is next to the Wafi Mall with an ecliptic selection of stores and cafes. The mall is also a starting point for the Hop On Hop Off tour which is one of the best ways to see the city and meet other visitors from around the world.
reviews.title: Best Service Ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It took me a while to write this review because the memories from our stay are so many, so vivid and so magical that I didn't know how to start. Who am I kidding? The main reason is that I knew I wished I was back there right now… This is one of those places you wish you owned… so you could live there forever.
reviews.title: Epitome of luxury

reviews.text: What started with a minor misunderstanding over pickup at the airport, turned out to be the single best hotel experience we have ever had (and we've had many). On my first visit to Dubai, I could only stay in Raffles for 2 nights because I had pre-booked (for variety) another 2 nights at the Palace Downtown, another 5-star hotel with great recommendation. When leaving I told Carlo the concierge that I was sure it wouldn't live up to Raffles' standards. And it didn't. The attention to detail, the quality of the rooms (we stayed on the 13th floor), the attentiveness, politeness and character of the staff is simply above all standards. It may not be exactly at the centre of town but really, who cares? You'll take a deep breath of happiness every time you step in this place. Next visit to Dubai will have to be all Raffles.
reviews.title: An impressive experience

reviews.text: First of all I'd like to thank the hotel management for their concern about their customers ..special thanks to Mr. Shadi Alhakim
reviews.title: Raffles isn't try to be the best. They are the best.

reviews.text: Secondly , I'd like to ask the hotel management to change the hotel from 5 stars to 7 stars..
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.text: All in all, I strongly recommend the travelers to try the unique .. delighted. .extraordinary ...experience with Raffles Dubai
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: Raffles is a good choice for a short stay in Dubai. The service is outstanding. Great food in the restaurant (though it is not cheap!). Rooms were spacious and clean. Lobby is a great place to relax and drink tea. Easy taxi ride to down town and airport.
reviews.title: Good choice for Dubai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed her in May of 2013 and found the hotel to be an amazing place, all the staff was so friendly and helpful, just stopping in lobby to check out things someone was always on hand asking if they could help. The room was magnificent and had everything you could want as a traveller. The only negative side was the location compared to the city centre and also the shopping centre attached was very quiet and not much to attract you, but could get big bus tour from the shopping centre which took you around town. Would definitely stay there again if travelling through Dubai.
reviews.title: Best Hotel i've ever stayed at

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This luxury hotel is Egyptian in decor and extremely opulent. We stayed in the executive floor rooms which provide fantastic value with the inclusions of breakfast, morning and afternoons teas (high tea with a middle eastern flavour)and cocktails and canapés at night- we never needed to buy food. Huge rooms with balcony, walk in dressing room, sitting area with chaise-lounge and wrtiting desk, bathroom with massive bath, twin sinks, walk in shower- all stunning. Oh and I forgot the butler too. We mentioned that the king bed was a little firm so housekeeping came up with a massive pillow topper to soften the bed- incredible service. We enjoyed sitting by the pool under a moroccan style tent for about an hour but still extremely hot so went shopping.
reviews.title: Best hotel experience ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wafi Centre is connected to the hotel and was very quiet when we visited despite having large selection of shops- so many shopping malls in Dubai now but very convenient. Have stayed in several 5 star hotels in Dubai but none compare to Raffl Dubai - we will definitely return.
reviews.title: Decadent treat

reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights and received excellent service. The room was huge, lost partner in the bed. Beautiful pool area which you need in the extreme heat.
reviews.title: helpful staff

description: Not only close to Dubai’s best-loved landmarks... Raffles Dubai is one of them. this stunning landmark city hotel in a distinctive pyramid shape, merges Asian style with an Egyptian aesthetic. Brilliant contemporary interiors, faultless service and superb restaurants. A shopping adventure lies around the corner as Raffles Dubai adjoins Wafi, one of Dubai’s most exclusive shopping and leisure destinations, home to hundreds of boutiques offering an extensive selection of international haute couture, jewellery and gifts. Nearby souks, including the impressive Khan Murjan, offer authentic crafts by artisans from the region. Featuring luxurious rooms and suites, this award-winning Dubai hotel offers some of the most spacious rooms in the city, each with generously-sized private balconies. 7 restaurants and bars offer an extensive array of dining, entertainment and clubbing options, while Raffles Spa beckons with a pampering menu to emerge transformed, like a lotus that journeys from bud to the radiance of full bloom.
